added.description: Minimum array size in bytes to use AVX512 intrinsicsfor copy, inflate and fill. When this value is set as zerocompare operations can also use AVX512 intrinsics.
added.name: AVX3Threshold

added.description: Abort VM when method had failed to compile.
added.name: AbortVMOnCompilationFailure

added.description: Abort upon failure to reach safepoint (see SafepointTimeout)
added.name: AbortVMOnSafepointTimeout

added.description: Abort upon failure to complete VM operation promptly
added.name: AbortVMOnVMOperationTimeout

added.description: Delay in milliseconds for option AbortVMOnVMOperationTimeout
added.name: AbortVMOnVMOperationTimeoutDelay

added.description: If true, sets bit 2 of /proc/PID/coredump_filter, thus resulting in file-backed private mappings of the process to be dumped into the corefile.
added.name: DumpPrivateMappingsInCore

added.description: If true, sets bit 3 of /proc/PID/coredump_filter, thus resulting in file-backed shared mappings of the process to be dumped into the corefile.
added.name: DumpSharedMappingsInCore

added.description: Force eager JVMCI initialization
added.name: EagerJVMCI

added.description: Use elastic policy to manage TLAB sizes. This conserves memory for non-actively allocating threads, even when they request large TLABs for themselves. Active threads would experience smaller TLABs until policy catches up.
added.name: EpsilonElasticTLAB

added.description: Use timed decays to shrik TLAB sizes. This conserves memory for the threads that allocate in bursts of different sizes, for example the small/rare allocations coming after the initial large burst.
added.name: EpsilonElasticTLABDecay

added.description: Max TLAB size to use with Epsilon GC. Larger value improves performance at the expense of per-thread memory waste. This asks TLAB machinery to cap TLAB sizes at this value.
added.name: EpsilonMaxTLABSize

added.description: Min expansion step for heap. Larger value improves performance at the potential expense of memory waste.
added.name: EpsilonMinHeapExpand

added.description:
Print heap occupancy stats with this number of steps.
0 turns the printing off.
added.name: EpsilonPrintHeapSteps

added.description: TLAB sizing policy decays to initial size after thread had not allocated for this long. Time is in milliseconds. Lower value improves memory footprint, but penalizes actively allocating threads.
added.name: EpsilonTLABDecayTime

added.description: Multiplier to use when deciding on next TLAB size. Larger value improves performance at the expense of per-thread memory waste. Lower value improves memory footprint, but penalizes actively allocating threads.
added.name: EpsilonTLABElasticity

added.description: Update heap occupancy counters after allocating this much memory. Higher values would make allocations faster at the expense of lower resolution in heap counters.
added.name: EpsilonUpdateCountersStep

added.description: If true, error data is printed to stderr instead of a file
added.name: ErrorFileToStderr

added.description: If true, error data is printed to stdout instead of a file
added.name: ErrorFileToStdout

added.description: Error reports are more extensive.
added.name: ExtensiveErrorReports

added.description: Enable Flight Recorder
added.name: FlightRecorder

added.description: Flight Recorder options
added.name: FlightRecorderOptions

added.description: Chunk size used for rebuilding the remembered set.
added.name: G1RebuildRemSetChunkSize

added.description: Concurrently preclean java.lang.ref.references instances before the Remark pause.
added.name: G1UseReferencePrecleaning

added.description: Inject thread creation failures for UseDynamicNumberOfCompilerThreads
added.name: InjectCompilerCreationFailure

added.description: Calculate the container CPU availability based on the value of quotas (if set), when true. Otherwise, use the CPU shares value, provided it is less than quota.
added.name: PreferContainerQuotaForCPUCount

added.description: Print more information in thread dump
added.name: PrintExtendedThreadInfo

added.description: Reduce the number of parallel compiler threads when they are not used
added.name: ReduceNumberOfCompilerThreads

added.description: Ergonomically start one thread for this amount of references for reference processing if ParallelRefProcEnabled is true. Specify 0 to disable and use all threads.
added.name: ReferencesPerThread

added.description: Testing: make lots of artificial allocation failures.
added.name: ShenandoahAllocFailureALot

added.description: How much of heap should some heuristics reserve for absorbing the allocation spikes. Larger value wastes more memory in non-emergency cases, but provides more safety in emergency cases. In percents of (soft) max heap size.
added.name: ShenandoahAllocSpikeFactor

added.description: How many new allocations should happen since the last GC cycle before some heuristics trigger the collection. In percents of (soft) max heap size. Set to zero to effectively disable.
added.name: ShenandoahAllocationThreshold

added.description: Unconditionally clear soft references, instead of using any other cleanup policy. This minimizes footprint at expense ofmore soft reference churn in applications.
added.name: ShenandoahAlwaysClearSoftRefs

added.description: Turn on/off CAS barriers in Shenandoah
added.name: ShenandoahCASBarrier

added.description: Turn on/off clone barriers in Shenandoah
added.name: ShenandoahCloneBarrier

added.description: Use this style to scan the code cache roots: 0 - sequential iterator; 1 - parallel iterator; 2 - parallel iterator with cset filters;
added.name: ShenandoahCodeRootsStyle

added.description: The time period for one step in control loop interval adjustment. Lower values make adjustments faster, at the expense of higher perf overhead. Time is in milliseconds.
added.name: ShenandoahControlIntervalAdjustPeriod

added.description: The maximum sleep interval for control loop that drives the cycles. Lower values would increase GC responsiveness to changing heap conditions, at the expense of higher perf overhead. Time is in milliseconds.
added.name: ShenandoahControlIntervalMax

added.description: The minimum sleep interval for the control loop that drives the cycles. Lower values would increase GC responsiveness to changing heap conditions, at the expense of higher perf overhead. Time is in milliseconds.
added.name: ShenandoahControlIntervalMin

added.description: How much of the heap needs to be free after recovery cycles, either Degenerated or Full GC to be claimed successful. If this much space is not available, next recovery step would be triggered.
added.name: ShenandoahCriticalFreeThreshold

added.description: Enable Degenerated GC as the graceful degradation step. Disabling this option leads to degradation to Full GC instead. When running in passive mode, this can be toggled to measure either Degenerated GC or Full GC costs.
added.name: ShenandoahDegeneratedGC

added.description: Use Elastic TLABs with Shenandoah
added.name: ShenandoahElasticTLAB

added.description: How much of heap to reserve for evacuations. Larger values make GC evacuate more live objects on every cycle, while leaving less headroom for application to allocate in. In percents of total heap size.
added.name: ShenandoahEvacReserve

added.description: Allow evacuations to overflow the reserved space. Enabling it will make evacuations more resilient when evacuation reserve/waste is incorrect, at the risk that application runs out of memory too early.
added.name: ShenandoahEvacReserveOverflow

added.description: How much waste evacuations produce within the reserved space. Larger values make evacuations more resilient against evacuation conflicts, at expense of evacuating less on each GC cycle.
added.name: ShenandoahEvacWaste

added.description: How many back-to-back Degenerated GCs should happen before going to a Full GC.
added.name: ShenandoahFullGCThreshold

added.description: GC heuristics to use. This fine-tunes the GC mode selected, by choosing when to start the GC, how much to process on each cycle, and what other features to automatically enable. Possible values are: adaptive - adapt to maintain the given amount of free heap at all times, even during the GC cycle; static - trigger GC when free heap falls below the threshold; aggressive - run GC continuously, try to evacuate everything; compact - run GC more frequently and with deeper targets to free up more memory.
added.name: ShenandoahGCHeuristics

added.description: GC mode to use. Among other things, this defines which barriers are in in use. Possible values are: satb - snapshot-at-the-beginning concurrent GC (three pass mark-evac-update); iu - incremental-update concurrent GC (three pass mark-evac-update); passive - stop the world GC only (either degenerated or full)
added.name: ShenandoahGCMode

added.description: How much garbage a region has to contain before it would be taken for collection. This a guideline only, as GC heuristics may select the region for collection even if it has little garbage. This also affects how much internal fragmentation the collector accepts. In percents of heap region size.
added.name: ShenandoahGarbageThreshold

added.description: Many heuristics would guarantee a concurrent GC cycle at least with this interval. This is useful when large idle intervals are present, where GC can run without stealing time from active application. Time is in milliseconds. Setting this to 0 disables the feature.
added.name: ShenandoahGuaranteedGCInterval

added.description: Allow moving humongous regions. This makes GC more resistant to external fragmentation that may otherwise fail other humongous allocations, at the expense of higher GC copying costs. Currently affects stop-the-world (Full) cycle only.
added.name: ShenandoahHumongousMoves

added.description: Humongous objects are allocated in separate regions. This setting defines how large the object should be to be deemed humongous. Value is in percents of heap region size. This also caps the maximum TLAB size.
added.name: ShenandoahHumongousThreshold

added.description: The cycle may shortcut when enough garbage can be reclaimed from the immediate garbage (completely garbage regions). In percents of total garbage found. Setting this threshold to 100 effectively disables the shortcut.
added.name: ShenandoahImmediateThreshold

added.description: Should internally-caused GC requests invoke concurrent cycles, should they do the stop-the-world (Degenerated / Full GC)? Many heuristics automatically enable this. This option is similar to global ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent.
added.name: ShenandoahImplicitGCInvokesConcurrent

added.description: How much heap should be free before some heuristics trigger the initial (learning) cycles. Affects cycle frequency on startup and after drastic state changes, e.g. after degenerated/full GC cycles. In percents of (soft) max heap size.
added.name: ShenandoahInitFreeThreshold

added.description: The number of cycles some heuristics take to collect in order to learn application and GC performance.
added.name: ShenandoahLearningSteps

added.description: Turn on/off load-reference barriers in Shenandoah
added.name: ShenandoahLoadRefBarrier

added.description: Attempt more loop opts after barrier expansion.
added.name: ShenandoahLoopOptsAfterExpansion

added.description: How many items to process during one marking iteration before checking for cancellation, yielding, etc. Larger values improve marking performance at expense of responsiveness.
added.name: ShenandoahMarkLoopStride

added.description: How many objects to prefetch ahead when traversing mark bitmaps.Set to 0 to disable prefetching.
added.name: ShenandoahMarkScanPrefetch

added.description: With automatic region sizing, the regions would be at most this large.
added.name: ShenandoahMaxRegionSize

added.description: How much heap should be free before most heuristics trigger the collection, even without other triggers. Provides the safety margin for many heuristics. In percents of (soft) max heap size.
added.name: ShenandoahMinFreeThreshold

added.description: With automatic region sizing, the regions would be at least this large.
added.name: ShenandoahMinRegionSize

added.description: Testing: simulate OOM during evacuation.
added.name: ShenandoahOOMDuringEvacALot

added.description: Optimize barriers on static final fields. Turn it off for maximum compatibility with reflection or JNI code that manipulates final fields.
added.name: ShenandoahOptimizeStaticFinals

added.description: Pace application allocations to give GC chance to start and complete before allocation failure is reached.
added.name: ShenandoahPacing

added.description: How much of free space to take as non-taxable allocations the GC cycle. Larger value makes the pacing milder at the beginning of the GC cycle. Lower value makes the pacing less uniform during the cycle. In percent of free space.
added.name: ShenandoahPacingCycleSlack

added.description: How much of heap counted as non-taxable allocations during idle phases. Larger value makes the pacing milder when collector is idle, requiring less rendezvous with control thread. Lower value makes the pacing control less responsive to out-of-cycle allocs. In percent of total heap size.
added.name: ShenandoahPacingIdleSlack

added.description: Max delay for pacing application allocations. Larger values provide more resilience against out of memory, at expense at hiding the GC latencies in the allocation path. Time is in milliseconds. Setting it to arbitrarily large value makes GC effectively stall the threads indefinitely instead of going to degenerated or Full GC.
added.name: ShenandoahPacingMaxDelay

added.description: Additional pacing tax surcharge to help unclutter the heap. Larger values makes the pacing more aggressive. Lower values risk GC cycles finish with less memory than were available at the beginning of it.
added.name: ShenandoahPacingSurcharge

added.description: How many regions to process at once during parallel region iteration. Affects heaps with lots of regions.
added.name: ShenandoahParallelRegionStride

added.description: Do concurrent preclean phase before final mark: process definitely alive references to avoid dealing with them during pause.
added.name: ShenandoahPreclean

added.description: Process process weak (soft, phantom, finalizers) references every Nth cycle. Normally affects concurrent GC cycles only, as degenerated and full GCs would try to process references regardless. Set to zero to disable reference processing completely.
added.name: ShenandoahRefProcFrequency

added.description: Provide heap region sampling data via jvmstat.
added.name: ShenandoahRegionSampling

added.description: Sampling rate for heap region sampling. In milliseconds between the samples. Higher values provide more fidelity, at expense of more sampling overhead.
added.name: ShenandoahRegionSamplingRate

added.description: Static heap region size. Set zero to enable automatic sizing.
added.name: ShenandoahRegionSize

added.description: Turn on/off SATB barriers in Shenandoah
added.name: ShenandoahSATBBarrier

added.description: Forcefully flush non-empty SATB buffers at this interval. Time is in milliseconds.
added.name: ShenandoahSATBBufferFlushInterval

added.description: Number of entries in an SATB log buffer.
added.name: ShenandoahSATBBufferSize

added.description: Fix references with load reference barrier. Disabling this might degrade performance.
added.name: ShenandoahSelfFixing

added.description: Soft limit for maximum heap size (in bytes)
added.name: ShenandoahSoftMaxHeapSize

added.description: Turn on/off enqueuing of oops for storeval barriers
added.name: ShenandoahStoreValEnqueueBarrier

added.description: Suspend concurrent GC worker threads at safepoints
added.name: ShenandoahSuspendibleWorkers

added.description: With automatic region sizing, this is the approximate number of regions that would be used, within min/max region size limits.
added.name: ShenandoahTargetNumRegions

added.description: Allow to uncommit memory under unused regions and metadata. This optimizes footprint at expense of allocation latency in regions that require committing back. Uncommits would be disabled by some heuristics, or with static heap size.
added.name: ShenandoahUncommit

added.description: Uncommit memory for regions that were not used for more than this time. First use after that would incur allocation stalls. Actively used regions would never be uncommitted, because they do not become unused longer than this delay. Time is in milliseconds. Setting this delay to 0 effectively uncommits regions almost immediately after they become unused.
added.name: ShenandoahUncommitDelay

added.description: Unload the classes every Nth cycle. Normally affects concurrent GC cycles, as degenerated and full GCs would try to unload classes regardless. Set to zero to disable class unloading.
added.name: ShenandoahUnloadClassesFrequency

added.description: Enable internal verification. This would catch many GC bugs, but it would also stall the collector during the verification, which prolongs the pauses and might hide other bugs.
added.name: ShenandoahVerify

added.description: Verification level, higher levels check more, taking more time. Accepted values are: 0 = basic heap checks; 1 = previous level, plus basic region checks; 2 = previous level, plus all roots; 3 = previous level, plus all reachable objects; 4 = previous level, plus all marked objects
added.name: ShenandoahVerifyLevel

added.description: Verify no missing barriers in C2.
added.name: ShenandoahVerifyOptoBarriers

added.description: On internal errors, include registers in error report.
added.name: ShowRegistersOnAssert

added.description: Start flight recording with options
added.name: StartFlightRecording

added.description: Stress inlining through method handle linkers
added.name: StressMethodHandleLinkerInlining

added.description: Trace creation and removal of compiler threads
added.name: TraceCompilerThreads

added.description: Use intrinsics for java.util.Base64
added.name: UseBASE64Intrinsics

added.description: 0: when resolving InDy or ConDy, force all BSM arguments to be resolved before the bootstrap method is called; 1: when a BSM that may accept a BootstrapCallInfo is detected, use that API to pass BSM arguments, which allows the BSM to delay their resolution; 2+: stress test the BCI API by calling more BSMs via that API, instead of with the eagerly-resolved array.
added.name: UseBootstrapCallInfo

added.description: Use byte reverse instructions.
added.name: UseByteReverseInstructions

added.description: Enables intrinsification of java.lang.Character functions
added.name: UseCharacterCompareIntrinsics

added.description: Use count trailing zeros instructions.
added.name: UseCountTrailingZerosInstructionsPPC64

added.description: Dynamically choose the number of parallel compiler threads
added.name: UseDynamicNumberOfCompilerThreads

added.description: Use the Epsilon (no-op) garbage collector
added.name: UseEpsilonGC

added.description: Use platform unstable time where supported for timestamps only
added.name: UseFastUnorderedTimeStamps

added.description: Use the original JNI name escaping scheme
added.name: UseLegacyJNINameEscaping

added.description: move predicates out of loops based on profiling data
added.name: UseProfiledLoopPredicate

added.description: Use SIMD instructions in generated array equals code
added.name: UseSIMDForArrayEquals

added.description: Use simpliest and shortest implementation for array equals
added.name: UseSimpleArrayEquals

added.description: leverage profiling for table/lookup switch
added.name: UseSwitchProfiling

added.description: Use XMM/YMM MOVDQU instruction for Object Initialization
added.name: UseXMMForObjInit

added.description: Use the Z garbage collector
added.name: UseZGC

added.description: Verify metaspace on chunk movements.
added.name: VerifyMetaspace

added.description: Allocation spike tolerance factor
added.name: ZAllocationSpikeTolerance

added.description: Force GC at a fixed time interval (in seconds)
added.name: ZCollectionInterval

added.description: Clean JNI WeakGlobalRefs concurrently
added.name: ZConcurrentJNIWeakGlobalHandles

added.description: Clean StringTable concurrently
added.name: ZConcurrentStringTable

added.description: Clean VM WeakHandles concurrently
added.name: ZConcurrentVMWeakHandles

added.description: Maximum allowed heap fragmentation
added.name: ZFragmentationLimit

added.description: Maximum number of bytes allocated for marking stacks
added.name: ZMarkStacksMax

added.description: Apply load barrier optimizations
added.name: ZOptimizeLoadBarriers

added.description: Filesystem path for Java heap backing storage (must be a tmpfs or a hugetlbfs filesystem)
added.name: ZPath

added.description: Enable proactive GC cycles
added.name: ZProactive

added.description: Allow Java threads to stall and wait for GC to complete instead of immediately throwing an OutOfMemoryError
added.name: ZStallOnOutOfMemory

added.description: Force tracing of ZStats
added.name: ZStatisticsForceTrace

added.description: Time between statistics print outs (in seconds)
added.name: ZStatisticsInterval

added.description: Unload unused VM symbols
added.name: ZSymbolTableUnloading

added.description: Unmap bad (inactive) heap views
added.name: ZUnmapBadViews

added.description: Verify forwarding tables
added.name: ZVerifyForwarding

added.description: Verify that reference loads are followed by barriers
added.name: ZVerifyLoadBarriers

added.description: Verify marking stacks
added.name: ZVerifyMarking

added.description: Treat JNI WeakGlobalRefs and StringTable as weak roots
added.name: ZWeakRoots

removed.description: Timeout in ms the attach listener waits for a request
removed.name: AttachListenerTimeout

removed.description: Temporary - see javaClasses.cpp
removed.name: CheckAssertionStatusDirectives

removed.description: Verify the endorsed and extension directories are not used
removed.name: CheckEndorsedAndExtDirs

removed.description: (Unsafe,Unstable,Deprecated) Number of iterations in safepoint loop before changing safepoint polling page to RO
removed.name: DeferPollingPageLoopCount

removed.description: (Unstable, Deprecated) Number of times to iterate in safepoint loop before blocking VM threads
removed.name: DeferThrSuspendLoopCount

removed.description: Die upon failure to reach safepoint (see SafepointTimeout)
removed.name: DieOnSafepointTimeout

removed.description: tell sim not to invoke bccheck callback
removed.name: DisableBCCheck

removed.description: Enable event-based tracing
removed.name: EnableTracing

removed.description: (Deprecated) Use fast TLAB refill code
removed.name: FastTLABRefill

removed.description: If true, generate region filtering code in RS barrier
removed.name: G1RSBarrierRegionFilter

removed.description: When true, do RS scrubbing after cleanup.
removed.name: G1ScrubRemSets

removed.description: The number of regions we will add to the secondary free list at every append operation
removed.name: G1SecondaryFreeListAppendLength

removed.description: It stresses the concurrent region freeing operation
removed.name: G1StressConcRegionFreeing

removed.description: Artificial delay during concurrent region freeing
removed.name: G1StressConcRegionFreeingDelayMillis

removed.description: intrinsify subset of notify
removed.name: InlineNotify

removed.description: Call loadClassInternal() rather than loadClass()
removed.name: MustCallLoadClassInternal

removed.description: (Unstable)
removed.name: NativeMonitorFlags

removed.description: (Unstable)
removed.name: NativeMonitorSpinLimit

removed.description: (Unstable)
removed.name: NativeMonitorTimeout

removed.description: tell the AArch64 sim where we are in method code
removed.name: NotifySimulator

removed.description: Print all malloc/free calls
removed.name: PrintMalloc

removed.description: Trace calls to C heap malloc/free allocation
removed.name: PrintMallocFree

removed.description: (Unstable, Deprecated)
removed.name: SafepointSpinBeforeYield

removed.description: Show message about safepoint synchronization
removed.name: ShowSafepointMsgs

removed.description: Trace scavenge
removed.name: TraceScavenge

removed.description: Unstable: VM calls loadClass unsynchronized. Custom class loader must call VM synchronized for findClass and defineClass.
removed.name: UnsyncloadClass

removed.description: Enable Application Class Data Sharing when using shared spaces
removed.name: UseAppCDS

removed.description: Use CGroup memory limit as physical memory limit for heap sizingDeprecated, replaced by container support
removed.name: UseCGroupMemoryLimitForHeap

removed.description: Use locked-tracing when doing event-based tracing
removed.name: UseLockedTracing

removed.description: tell sim to cache memory updates until exclusive op occurs
removed.name: UseSimulatorCache

removed.description: Adjust the timestamp returned from stat() to be UTC
removed.name: UseUTCFileTimestamp
